review_title: Great Place to Work, Not a lot of Opportunity for Growth
pros: Centers employees unlike any other place I've worked. Great benefits. Reasonable hours.
cons: Very little opportunity for growth within the organization. The job you're hired for is likely the job you will do, with some small promotions, for the duration of your time at Ford.

pros: Very supportive Great place to work
cons: Low opportunities to grow inside the organization

review_title: Uninspiring but stable and decent environment
pros: Work-life balance, stability, pay and benefits.
cons: Uninspiring work with the heads of the institution earning more than seems justifiable. People seem to overestimate the value of their work (opposed to the work of grantees).

job_title: Program Officer in New York, NY
pros: Intellectually stimulating environment with amazing colleagues
cons: Ultimately it is a large bureaucracy

job_title: Program Manager in New York, NY
pros: Good management, experience colleagues and nice time sharing
cons: Work hours not suitable enough

job_title: Department Manager in New York, NY
pros: Great benefits and salary that start immediately upon hire. Friendly staff.
cons: The workload can get heavy at times and there are often too many people working on the same tasks and not speaking with each other.

job_title: Senior Program Officer in New York, NY
pros: Nice colleagues, Nice impactful programs
cons: Term limited and management can be a bit unrealistic

pros: Its a good place to work
cons: More budget for training should be made

review_title: Ford Foundation is a great employer
pros:
generous salary and benefits
capacity building opportunity
supportive work environment
great culture of work
promote diversity and inclusion
cons: For now I feel content working at the Foundation

job_title: Program Associate in New York, NY
pros: There's a culture of acceptance combined with urgency and high expectations. Leadership exerts itself to listen to the needs and ideas of staff. The foundation has sincerely sought a (perhaps impossible) balance between expediency and being truly "horizontal" rather than hierarchical.
cons: Extremely complex nature of the organizational mission and scope of the foundation's endowment generates bureaucracy, while at the same time and in contrast, severe understaffing repeatedly creates bottlenecks and barriers in the process of implementing Ford's desired state of grantmaking sophistication and collaboration.

pros: Mission driven, smart colleagues, good benefits, beautiful office
cons: Hierarchical, very traditional culture dominated by old fashioned power dynamics, archaic systems, prides itself on being understaffed, doesn't live its social justice values internally, treats staff as expendable resources

job_title: Facilities Associate in New York, NY
pros: amazing community amazing benefits respect for all
cons: can be a little too left leaning sometimes

pros: They go over and above to ensure employees are treated right and are compensated well above the market.
cons: Not much upward growth for people who want to grow with org

pros:
global learning and exposure
opportunity to interact meaningfully with civil society
cons: limited opportunities for growth and mobility within organisation

job_title: Strategic Communications Officer in New York, NY
pros: Amazing impact, a large network of global leaders and orgs working to combat inequality, and critical work. Amazing benefits!
cons: Don't have much to say on this.

job_title: Project Coordinator in New York, NY
pros: Benefits, management, team work, pay.
cons: None that I can think of.

pros: The Ford Foundation is a great place to work.
cons: There are no comments about Cons.

job_title: Grants Manager in New York, NY
pros: A great place to work
cons: Can’t think of any cons

job_title: Program Officer in New York, NY
pros: Work-life balance, bennefits, and missionality of work
cons: limited career develeopment options and fixed term periods

pros: Ford Foundation cares for its people
cons: Cannot think of any cons

job_title: International Development Consultant in Epsom, England
pros: Motivating Energizing Social Justice Mission; An excellent employer
cons: There was no downside to the 8 years I spent with the Ford Foundation!

pros: Leadership is excellent. Supports the staff.
cons: Big organization, easy to get lost in the sea

review_title: Could be a special place, but its seriously not
job_title: Program Officer in New York, NY
pros: Important and timely legacy and current mission.  Ford is an institution where you can help enact real positive change in the areas and field we work on.
cons: Ford is place of many contradictions, while we seek to empower people and communities, we fail on a regular basis to empower our own staff and create a culture where everyone matters.  Top down hierarchical culture still reigns supreme.  There are managers and Directors that while may be "experts" in the field, lack basic interpersonal skills, and other senior leadership who have been at the Foundation too long and are complacent.

review_title: Lacks internal cohesion and team spirit
pros: Good benefits, reasonable hours, beautiful building.
cons: President seems not to trust his staff, micromanaging everyone (Ford has some excellent program officers, but he's not letting them do their jobs). He knows little about the field but hasn't let that stop him. He issues ultimatums that staff must do his bidding, and if they push back they will lose their contracts. It's a tense environment, and it appears that Ubiñas is more interested in showy, visible funding (socialite style) than in the social justice sector that has made Ford a great foundation.  Many excellent program officers have been leaving, and it seems like Ubiñas will bring in whoever will do what he tells them-- even though he's a lifelong management consultant with little knowledge about any of Ford's areas.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: The People!  The Mission!   This is an organization that really cares for people, internally and externally.  Very smart, dedicated staff around the world who want to make a positive difference in the world. management is asking and listening more which has resulted in recent positive changes to support the staff and the culture, example, more internal promotions, better support for professional development, better family-support policies.
cons: The organization is going through a lot of change at this time which is hard.   But the leadership has been transparent and informative and has involved staff in the change from the beginning. The building is beautiful but it feels worn - that will change with planned renovations.  Career opportunities can be limited because people stay a long time and it's not a huge organization.

review_title: Cheating the IRS at The Ford Foundation!
job_title: Correspondence Control Specialist in New York, NY
pros: Free coffee, subsidized cafeteria, and fancy restaurant to entertain quests. Many opulent benefits, including retirement plans. That is about it, however.
cons: I worked in the Correspondence Control Unit, reading and digesting all incoming mail for three units within the foundation. Using an ACCESS program, a given grant proposal had to be reduced to one line for the opening sentence of a rejection letter sent out by the administrative assistant of the office of the unit's program officer, who probably never reads the proposal. Most funding is done in person through established contacts in the cafeteria and restaurant. The CCU was maintained to keep documentation for the Internal Revenue Service to "prove" that all proposals are considered, which is far from the truth!

job_title: Senior Program Assistant in New York, NY
pros:
- Smart people
- Pleasant work atmosphere
- Opportunities to learn and network with others doing great social justice work
- Great benefits, although this is changing
- Good location
- Wonderful public events
- Awesome building with cool artwork and a cafeteria 
- Generous vacation time
cons:
-Cronyism runs rampant
-Raises and salary increases are not based on your contributions to the organization but on favoritism, i.e., if you're "friends" with your boss
-Managerial-centric organization
-Little to no growth or mobility
-Inefficient systems and processes
-"Busy work" gets praised over  real contributions and lasting impact

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: You can meet people who do really great work, depending on what area you work in. The large cafeteria serves hot lunch daily, and you can get a great cup of coffee if you just need to take a break. Organization now hosts many events that are open to employees.
cons: Employees tend to be pigeon-holed in positions. If you start off in one area, it's almost impossible to move to another.

review_title: A Dynamic Place Dedicated to Change
pros:
-New arrivals welcome to approach senior-level staff with questions
-Everyone is open to meeting others in their department
-Great workplace with free coffee/tea and an affordable cafeteria
-Monthly town halls with updates on professional and personal successes
-Culture of "change" emphasizes commitment to social change
cons:
-Could use more horizontal interaction/collaboration between different teams
-Many planning meetings create atmosphere of hyperactivity
-Personal information has potential to travel quickly via gossip
-Conferences with grantees are either very small or very large

review_title: A good place to be challenged and grow.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: The people. They are some of the best folks in the field and collectively contribute to an environment that can feel mercurial. A bit show-offish at times but you will learn a ton and be afforded the space to thrive.
cons: Large institution currently undergoing a historic change process that is tackling too many things at once. So you need to be willing to adapt on the move and not expect too much hand holding. Communication can be a challenge at times as well.

job_title: Senior Program Officer in New York, NY
pros: The foundation has a powerful and important mission. The privilege to advance social justice and racial equity by supporting amazing grantees is unparalleled.
cons: Uncertain, distracted, and indecisive leadership at the top.  Program strategies that change frequently to follow fads. Grant dollars taken away from core programs. People not empowered and trusted to lead.

pros: People really care about the work they are doing and about each other. Lots of support provided to staff for development and career growth. The benefits are wonderful and pay is also good.
cons: Because of the small size there is not a lot of opportunities for advancement within the foundation. If that is a focus of yours you need to think about how your work at the foundation will prepare you for what comes next, which is most likely to be an external opportunity.

pros: The organization is not too big-comfortable size. The work is really enjoyable and one feels motivated to do one's best.  Dynamic environment and super-smart people.  The leader of the organization is very in touch with all staff globally.
cons: The organization is trying it's best to address work/life balance issues but on the ground, and in reality, this remains something of a pipe-dream. But there is progress, albeit slow.

pros: Meaningful work with lots of resources and opportunities to meet amazing groups doing great work to advance social justice. Some amazing colleagues.
cons: Toxic culture with very top down leadership. Out of touch with community-based needs, constant strategic planning rather than centering and adequately resourcing the social justice sector. Many grants are made from the leadership level to flavor of the month organizations. The leadership is not very diverse.

review_title: Good place to start out a career
pros: Experience depends on which department an employee works in. Company has great events for employees, especially during the summer. Overall, I would recommend the experience.
cons: The company's main goal is for the public good and to assist those in need, but sometimes it seems a little too concerned on its image and being flashy.

review_title: A Terrific Opportunity to Learn About the World
pros: The people around you every day are all there to help benefit mankind in some way, shape or form. Employees are very friendly and are eager to help you learn.
cons: The work load could have been more encompassing. There were not a lot of opportunities for challenges, but the work amount was fair to say the least.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Great colleagues, commitment to a more just and fair world, global reach and networks, exposure to creative arts and media, inspiring and driven CEO, rich history and legacy and brand
cons: Work weeks can be very demanding, some jobs also have demanding travel and tough deadlines, extended process of organizational change has been tough for many staff (though it’s important for renewing the place)

review_title: Great work environment but no growth
job_title: Department Coordinator in New York, NY
pros: Very good benefits, excellent opportunities for learning about different areas of philanthropy and social change, work with very smart people.
cons: Little to no mobility, easy to get pigeon-holed in a particular role within the organization, managers and senior staff should be required to partake in leadership training, favoritism is often apparent.

review_title: Hypocritical with Real Culture of Intimidation
pros: Great building with free parking; 3% raise per annum with a very good work-life balance; people who don't know the true Ford Foundation still consider it a reputable institution.
cons: HR has "policies," but they only apply them as and when they want to. The things that go on at this place behind closed doors would make anyone sick. There is a real culture of intimidation and the word "blackmail" was uttered on more that one occassion.

pros: A wonderful place to work.  You get to work with amazing staff with diverse backgrounds.  No matter what position you hold you feel like you are contributing to the Foundation's mission.  The company has a great culture with fantastic benefits.
cons: Not always a lot of room for upward movement.

review_title: Experience depends on your team, direct environments and leadership
job_title: Grants Manager in New York, NY
pros: Good benefits, great mission, smart people, friendly environment, good location, parking, dining room
cons: no room for advancement, elitist rules, little value placed on staff development

review_title: There is no better place to work.
job_title: Grants Manager in New York, NY
pros: Inspiring work, great compensation, beautiful building, outstanding mission, and excellent colleagues.
cons: Requires dedication, commitment to excellence, and self-awareness.

review_title: Bilingual Assistance at the Ford Foundation in Chile
job_title: Exploration Manager in New York, NY
pros: Very  pleasant working environment. Clean spaces and very nice office in Santiago Chile.- Easy and clear job instructions
cons: Only few administrative work, they didnt call me again

pros: Great company for folks that want to work for an organization with a mission such as the Times.  You live the news every day.
cons: Slow to change but making progress.

job_title: Program Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Outstanding reputation, amazing cafeteria food
cons: They are undergoing a huge restructuring of roles... many of the employees are simply NOT happy about this and talk about it constantly (complain)

pros:
- Diversity and scope of partners means you learn a lot.
- Provision of education opportunity for development.
cons:
- Communication challenges.
- Lots of changes and transition, you need to be very versatile and adaptable.

review_title: Leading institution at a crossroads due to leadership change
pros: Global & national perspective it offers; its leadership role within philanthropy; some great grantee colleagues; size of its giving
cons: New leadership's demonstrated lack of skill

review_title: Great place to work as an intern
pros: Made lots of awesome friends during my internship and it was fun
cons: Didn't really get to learn much in my field

review_title: Great Stepping Stone and Proffesional network
pros: Great Space to Learn about Social Change Issues
cons: There is a Glass Ceiling and not too many opportunities for Professional Grow

job_title: Program Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Best colleagues, great benefits and the work is amazing
cons: Not much growth for support staff

review_title: Wonderful experience, excellent company to work for.
pros: Great benefits package and salary, excellent work life balance
cons: Career growth opportunity is very low.

pros: Some good people, very friendly and nice helpful
cons: And then some bad people who dont mind there businesses

pros: Good employee benefits, working hours.etc
cons: Sometimes no work life balance.

pros: Love this place wish they would offer full time position
cons: A bit too relaxed in terms of pacing of work

pros: Awesome place to work, great work life balance
cons: No growth opportunities. No growth prospect for youngsters

review_title: Its nice to work there on full time basis
pros: comfortable job and nice environment to work
cons: lot of office politics involved

pros: Good organisation to work at
cons: Very corporate style of working

pros: Amazing culture and great place to work
